title: MVP: kiosk CLI for Kiosk App Platform
description:
Steam for Claude Code Apps - CLI component for interacting with kiosk.app

## Overview

The kiosk CLI enables users to:
- Run Claude Code apps from the Kiosk marketplace
- Publish their own apps to the platform
- Manage locally installed apps

## Key Concepts

- Apps are hosted on GitHub but published/indexed via kiosk.app API
- `~/.kiosk/` is the working directory (config + installed apps)
- `org/repo` shorthand for referencing apps
- KIOSK.md in repos contains Claude Code instructions for setup/run

## Commands (MVP)

- `kiosk run org/repo` - Install (if needed) and run an app
- `kiosk publish` - Publish current repo to kiosk.app
- `kiosk rm org/repo` - Remove a locally installed app
- `kiosk ls` - List installed apps
- `kiosk new` - Initialize a new kiosk app project

## Deferred

- `kiosk update` - Self-update CLI (needs CI/releases)

title: Initialize ~/.kiosk working directory and config
description:
## Summary

Create the foundational working directory structure at `~/.kiosk/` with config management.

## Requirements

- `~/.kiosk/` directory for all kiosk data
- `~/.kiosk/config.json` for configuration
- `~/.kiosk/apps/` for installed apps (cloned repos)

## Config Schema (initial)

```json
{
  "apiUrl": "https://kiosk.app",
  "appsDir": "~/.kiosk/apps"
}
```

## Behavior

- Commands that need the working directory should check if it exists
- If not, create it with sensible defaults
- Provide a helper function/package for config access

## Implementation Notes

- Consider a `internal/config` package
- Default apiUrl should be `https://kiosk.app` (override via config for dev)

title: Implement 'kiosk run org/repo' command
description:
## Summary

Run (install if needed, then run) a Claude Code app from the Kiosk marketplace.

## Usage

```bash
kiosk run org/repo
```

## Behavior

1. Ensure working directory is initialized (~/.kiosk/)
2. Check if app is in the index (`~/.kiosk/apps.json`)

### If app is NOT installed:
1. Fetch app info from `GET /api/kiosk/[appId]` to verify it exists
2. Call `GET /api/kiosk/[appId]/install` to get installation prompt
3. Create directory `~/.kiosk/apps/org/repo`
4. **Register app in index** with metadata from API
5. Exec Claude Code with the install prompt (which handles cloning, setup, and running)

### If app IS installed:
1. cd into `~/.kiosk/apps/org/repo`
2. Exec Claude Code with prompt to run the app (reference KIOSK.md)

## API Endpoints

- `GET /api/kiosk/[appId]` - Get app metadata
- `GET /api/kiosk/[appId]/install` - Get installation prompt (plain text)

## Implementation Notes

- Use `internal/appindex` package to check/register apps
- Map `org/repo` to appId (the app's slug in kiosk.app)
- Shell out to `claude` CLI with the prompt
- The install prompt handles git clone, setup, etc.
close_reason: Implemented run command with API client and Claude exec

title: Implement 'kiosk publish' command
description:
## Summary

Publish the current repository to kiosk.app marketplace.

## Usage

```bash
kiosk publish
# Run from within a git repo with a GitHub remote
```

## Behavior

1. Ensure working directory is initialized (~/.kiosk/)
2. Call `GET /api/create` to fetch the publishing prompt (plain text)
3. Exec Claude Code with the prompt
4. Claude Code will:
   - Auto-detect project info (package.json, README, git remote, etc.)
   - Check for Kiosk.md (help create one if missing)
   - Confirm details with user
   - Call `POST /api/kiosk` to publish
   - Output kiosk.app link

## API Endpoints

- `GET /api/create` - Returns plain text prompt for Claude Code
- `POST /api/kiosk` - Creates the app entry (called by Claude Code)

## Implementation Notes

- Fetch prompt from API, pass to `claude` CLI
- The prompt handles all the interactive flow
- CLI just needs to bootstrap the process

title: Implement 'kiosk rm org/repo' command
description:
## Summary

Remove a locally installed app.

## Usage

```bash
kiosk rm org/repo
```

## Behavior

1. Check if app is in the index (`~/.kiosk/apps.json`)
2. If not in index, show error message
3. If in index, prompt for confirmation (or use --force flag)
4. **Remove from index** and delete the directory at `~/.kiosk/apps/org/repo`

## Implementation Notes

- Use `internal/appindex` package to check/unregister apps
- Consider --force flag to skip confirmation
- Should NOT remove from kiosk.app (that would be unpublish)
- Handle case where directory is missing but app is in index (just clean up index)

title: Implement 'kiosk ls' command
description:
## Summary

List locally installed apps from the app index.

## Usage

```bash
kiosk ls
```

## App Index

Apps are tracked in `~/.kiosk/apps.json`:

```json
{
  "apps": {
    "org/repo": {
      "name": "App Name",
      "description": "Short description",
      "gitUrl": "https://github.com/org/repo",
      "installedAt": "2026-01-18T12:00:00Z",
      "updatedAt": "2026-01-18T12:00:00Z"
    }
  }
}
```

## Behavior

1. Load app index from `~/.kiosk/apps.json`
2. For each app in index, validate directory exists at `~/.kiosk/apps/org/repo`
3. Display list with status (installed / missing)
4. Print count at the end

## Output Format

```
Installed apps:

  anthropic/claude-starter
  reflective-technologies/cool-app

2 apps installed
```

Empty state:
```
No apps installed.
```

## Implementation Notes

- Create `internal/appindex` package for index management
- Index is source of truth; filesystem is validated against it
- Other commands (run, rm) will use this package to register/unregister apps
close_reason: Implemented appindex package and ls command

title: Implement 'kiosk config' command
description:
## Summary

Manage kiosk CLI configuration via command line.

## Usage

```bash
# Get a config value
kiosk config get apiUrl

# Set a config value
kiosk config set apiUrl http://localhost:3000

# Show all config
kiosk config list
```

## Behavior

- Uses JSON path syntax for nested values (if we add them later)
- Reads/writes to `~/.kiosk/config.json`
- `set` creates the config file if it doesn't exist

## Examples

```bash
# Switch to local dev server
kiosk config set apiUrl http://localhost:3000

# Switch back to production
kiosk config set apiUrl https://kiosk.app

# Check current config
kiosk config list
```

## Implementation Notes

- Subcommands: `get`, `set`, `list`
- Initialize working directory if needed
- Pretty print for `list` output

title: Investigate claude CLI not found when exec'ing from kiosk
description:
## Problem

When running `kiosk publish` or `kiosk run`, the exec'd `claude` command fails with:
```
Error: exec: "claude": executable file not found in $PATH
```

However, `claude` is installed and works in the user's shell (we're using it right now).

## Likely Cause

The Go `exec.Command` may not be inheriting the full shell PATH, especially if:
- claude is installed via a version manager or non-standard location
- PATH is set in shell config (.zshrc, .bashrc) but not in the login environment

## Potential Fixes

1. Use absolute path to claude (detect with `which claude` first)
2. Explicitly inherit PATH from parent process
3. Run through a shell: `exec.Command("sh", "-c", "claude ...")`
4. Document that claude must be in system PATH

## To Investigate

- Check where claude is installed: `which claude`
- Check if PATH differs between shell and Go exec
- Test with absolute path
close_reason: Fallback to interactive shell when claude not on PATH
